metadata.title: USN-6564-1 -- Node.js vulnerabilities
metadata.description: Hubert Kario discovered that Node.js incorrectly handled certain inputs. If a user or an automated system were tricked into opening a specially crafted input file, a remote attacker could possibly use this issue to obtain sensitive information. (CVE-2022-4304)  CarpetFuzz, Dawei Wang discovered that Node.js incorrectly handled certain inputs. If a user or an automated system were tricked into opening a specially crafted input file, a remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service. (CVE-2022-4450)  Octavio Galland and Marcel BÃ¶hme discovered that Node.js incorrectly handled certain inputs. If a user or an automated system were tricked into opening a specially crafted input file, a remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service. (CVE-2023-0215)  David Benjamin discovered that Node.js incorrectly handled certain inputs. If a user or an automated system were tricked into opening a specially crafted input file, a remote attacker could possibly use this issue to obtain sensitive information. (CVE-2023-0286)  Hubert Kario and Dmitry Belyavsky discovered that Node.js incorrectly handled certain inputs. If a user or an automated system were tricked into opening a specially crafted input file, a remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service. (CVE-2023-0401)  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-6564-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  libnode72 - 12.22.9~dfsg-1ubuntu3.3 libnode-dev - 12.22.9~dfsg-1ubuntu3.3 nodejs-doc - 12.22.9~dfsg-1ubuntu3.3 nodejs - 12.22.9~dfsg-1ubuntu3.3 No subscription required
